text: Three ships of the Royal Navy have been named Shamrock, after the plant: *, a schooner built at Bermuda in 1808 and wrecked in 1811. She was the name-ship of her class of 10-gun schooners. *, an unrated brig-sloop transferred to HM Revenue Service in 1833 and sold in 1867.Winfield (2008), pp. 346-47. *, an built in Sunderland, launched 1918 and scrapped in 1936.Sunderland in the Great War, By Clive Dunn, Gillian Dunn, page 85 ==Citations and references== Citations References * Category:Royal Navy ship names
title: HMS Shamrock
